title: How to make Native American flutes for beginners - Quora

response.answer_text: I’m not really sure if I understand the question, but… If this is a “how to build a flute if you’re a beginner” kind of question, you may want to start with the tutorials here: Crafting Flutes | Flute Craft - instead of branches or lumber, a person can use hollow bamboo pieces. A Native American Flute requires three elements: somehow accurate ratio between the bore size and length; unique sound mechanism and pentatonic tuning. Once these elements are in place, you get a Native American flute. Every amateur woodworker can build a NAF once he learns about basic measurements and shapes of the sound mechanism. And even if you’re not a woodworker, with some patience you can use simple handtools to create the instrument. If this is a “what Native American flutes are good for beginners” kind of question, then the answer is even simpler - every NAF works well for beginners. But I suggest to start with a flute in the key of A (A4). Bass flutes or high-pitch flutes require the player to utilize more breath control, while the popular keys like A, G or F#, well, they require less breath control. Other things, like the type of wood, are irrelevant. A NAF is a very simple instrument.

There are many challenges in making flutes which is why I don’t. There are several good manuals out there to give you the basics. One of them is this manual kieta Flute Making Manual from Cherry Cows Flutes. It is quite good. On facebook, there are several very good flute making groups who provide great answers to questions and are very supportive. Another way is to connect to a flute maker in your area and ask if you can spend some time with them to learn a little bit more about flute making. At flute festivals, there are sometimes flute making workshops that you can take as well. Here is another resource that gives you some of the basics, Native American - like PVC Flute
